thread.title: One of London's smallest houses goes on sale in Chelsea for £600k | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: One of London's smallest houses goes on sale in Chelsea for £600k | London Evening Standard

author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: One of London's smallest houses goes on sale in Chelsea for £600k | London Evening Standard
text:
Wednesday 15 February 2017 22:27 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard 'Proper gem': The property is valued at three times the average UK house price Douglas and Gordon 
A tiny one bedroom house in Chelsea – that is less than nine feet wide – has gone on sale for a staggering £600,000. 
The property, on the market for the first time in 50 years, is valued at almost three times the average UK house price despite needing a full renovation. 
Described by estate agents Douglas and Gordon as a “proper Chelsea gem”, it is located in Britten Street, an eight minute walk from South Kensington and Sloane Square stations. 
Douglas and Gordon added on their website: “This is an utterly charming one bedroom cottage quietly situated on one of Chelsea's prettiest streets, overlooking St Luke's Gardens”. The house in Britten Street has gone on sale for the first time in 50 years (Douglas and Gordon) 
It has one bedroom and one bathroom, and offers just 290 sq ft of floor space. 
Despite this, Ed McCulloch, sales manager at Douglas and Gordon, has claimed it could be worth up to £1 million. 'Utterly charming': The tiny house overlooks St Luke's Gardens (Douglas and Gordon) 
He told ITV a number of people had expressed interest in it and it has only been on the market for a week. 
He added: "People are looking for something that captures their imagination." More about:
